title: Features of a Well-Designed Survey
question_text:
Which of the statements is true?

I. A well-designed survey asks questions using the same wording for all of its subjects.
II. A well-designed survey uses volunteers to make sure that the survey is not an inconvenience for respondents.
III. A well-designed survey does not need to use a sample that is representative of the intended population as long as the sample size is large enough.
solution:
Statement I is true. The wording of questions in a survey should remain consistent for all subjects.

Statement II is false. Those who volunteer might not be representative of the population. In volunteer samples, it is common for those with strong opinions to be the only ones who participate.

Statement III is false. A large sample size cannot overcome the flaw of poor representation. For example, it would do no good to sample $50{,}000\text{ U. S. adults}$ for a presidential poll if only $10\%$ of those selected were women.
